question:
You are a math expert. When you respond, respond only with the Solution of the final Problem, thinking step by step. At the end of the Solution, when you give your final answer, write it in the form 'Final Answer: \\boxed{$answer$}. I hope it is correct.'
What is the remainder when $x^4-7x^3+9x^2+16x-13$ is divided by $x-3$?
inference: Final Answer: \\boxed{17}. I hope it is correct.
ground_truth:
Using the Remainder Theorem, the remainder when $f(x) = x^4-7x^3+9x^2+16x-13$ is divided by $x - 3$ is
$$\begin{aligned} f(3)&=3^4-7\cdot3^3+9\cdot3^2+16\cdot3-13 \\&= 3^3(3-7+3) + 35\\ &= \boxed{8}. \end{aligned}$$
